name: Countries with Amnesia Online Quiz | Geography | 10 Questions

questions.text: In the year 2000, Saudi Arabia and I agreed to a delimitation of my border. I border the Arabian and Red Sea along with the Gulf of Aden. I'm located in the Middle East and Joey Tribbiani from 'Friends' doesn't believe I'm a real place.
questions.explanation:
Yemen.

	My coastline is 1,746 kilometers in length. Over 19,000,000 people live in me. My capital is Sanaa and my highest point is Jabal an Nabi Shu'ayb.

questions.text: I am not only a country, but a continent. I am the home of a famous crocodile hunter. The western part of my country has a sea breeze known as 'the Doctor'.
questions.explanation:
Australia.

	I am not only a country, but a continent. I am the home of a famous crocodile hunter. I became a commonwealth in 1901 and I'm 7,686,850 square kilometers. My highest point is Mount Kosciusko. My south-western sea breeze is known as 'The Fremantle Doctor'.   I am the world's smallest continent and the sixth largest country. My capital is Canberra.

questions.text: Shakespeare's greatest love story took place in one of my northern cities. Sophia Petrillo from 'Golden Girls' was born in one of my cities and I'm shaped like a popular piece of footwear.
questions.explanation:
Italy.

	Italy became a nation-state in 1861 when King Victor Emmanuel was in charge. When the fascist Benito Mussolini allied with Nazi Germany it led to my defeat in WW 2. I am 301,230 square kilometers.

questions.text: The Dutch bought me in 1636. I am just slightly larger than Washington D.C and a popular vacation spot. The Beach Boys put my name in a famous song on the 'Cocktail' soundtrack.
questions.explanation:
Aruba.

	I am located in the Caribbean and have an area of 193 square kilometers. My highest point is Mount Jamanoto and my capital is Oranjestad. In 1990, my citizens stopped the move on making me an independent country.

questions.text: During WW 2, I was under a dictatorship. I border North Korea and Vietnam. When people eat my food, it is said they get hungry a few hours later. My citizens also invented spaghetti.
questions.explanation:
China.

	I have a land area of 9,596,960 square kilometers. I am the fourth largest country and Beijing is my capital.

questions.text: In 1909 the census said my men were the tallest race in Europe. I call different families that have one person in common a clan. Men  in my country wear a special kind of skirt called a kilt.
questions.explanation:
Scotland.

	I am 274 miles long from north to south. I make up 30% of the United Kingdom. The Stone of Destiny (Stone of Scone) in Edinburgh Castle is rumored to be the same stone Jacob rested his head on during his journey. Scotch tape was named after me.

questions.text: I didn't become an independent country until 1981. My people can look out over the Caribbean Sea. Guatemalan citizens have tried to settle in me. English is my official language even though my people speak different languages. If this helps you any, my name rhymes with sneeze.
questions.explanation:
Belize.

	I am 22,966 square kilometers in area. My highest point is Victoria Peak and I'm the only country in Central America without a coastline on the North Pacific Ocean. Belmopan is my capital.

questions.text: My country is famous for its bull runs and annual tomato fights. I was neutral during WW 1 and WW 2. The Pyrenees mountain range separates me from another European country.
questions.explanation:
Spain.

	I have a total area of 504,782 square kilometers. My highest point is Pico De Teide on Canary Islands, located southwest of me. Madrid is my capital.

questions.text: I am the largest country in the world. I also have a very cold desert. Joseph Stalin and Vladimir Lenin had cities in my country that were named after them.
questions.explanation:
Russia.

	I am 17,079,200 square kilometers in area. My highest point is Mount El'brus. I was involved in a Cold War with the United States of America from 1945 to 1991.

questions.text: My declaration of independence was signed in 1776. I have 50 states and I'm the most technologically powerful economy in the world. I don't have an official language.
questions.explanation:
United States of America.

	I am 9,629,091 in square kilometers making me the third largest country in the world. Mount McKinley is my highest point. My capital is Washington D.C., where the President of the United States lives.
